result.execSummary:
The defendant Troy J Mahl was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.

Defendant is to complete an alcohol and drug abuse assessment (AODA) and comply with any follow-up counseling as recommended.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to complete and submit proof of completion to the Clerk of Courts Office and the District Attorney's Office.
Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Troy J Mahl
Current: 301 Troy Drive, c/o Mendota Mental Health Institute, Madison, WI 53704 United States  (Effective: 04-05-2017)
Prior: 571 Cty Rd A, c/o Green Lake County Jail, Green Lake, WI 54941 United States

ADDRESS INFO for Troy J Mahl
Current: 571 Cty Rd A, c/o Green Lake County Jail, Green Lake, WI 54941 United States  (Effective: 02-24-2017)
Prior: 159 W John St, Markesan, WI 53946
from Clerk to Defendant re: Court-ordered Payment Arrangements

1:05 pm
Defendant Troy J Mahl in court.
Defendant's mother made statement regarding re-payment.  Defendant offers to pay $50 per month.
Court authorizes warrant - stayed.  Court orders Defendant to pay $50 per month, the 15th of every month, beginning November 15, 2016.
Court adjourned at 1:10 pm

3:45 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to count 1 with a fine, costs, AODA and DNA sample, and count 2 will be dismissed and read-in.  State concurs.  Atty Privat concurs.  Defendant concurs. 

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 as charged.  Court orders count 2 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Privat.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

-$100 fine plus costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.
-Defendant is to complete an alcohol and drug abuse assessment (AODA) and comply with any follow-up counseling as recommended.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to complete and submit proof of completion to the Clerk of Courts Office and the District Attorney's Office.

Court adjourned at 3:51 p.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 7, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

12:23 p.m.  No appearance by the Defendant.  Atty Barb Privat present on behalf of the defendant.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - discussed the offer with the defendant .  Court sets for plea & sentencing on June 7, 2016 at 3:30 p.m.

Court adjourned at 12:23 p.m.
Status hearing on May 10, 2016 at 11:30 am.

8:42 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Privat confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Atty Privat enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond.  Court will set for Status Hearing on May 10, 2016 at 11:30 a.m.  Court grants parties 10 days to request recusal.

Court adjourned at 8:44 a.m.
